intro: Leptodermis wardii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, pink, and white, are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Leptodermis wardii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
